p: Shagal et al. [ 33] concluded that phytochemical screening of three different plant parts using ethanol and water as solvent showed that tannins, saponins, flavonoids, phenols, and volatile oils were present, and ethanol extracts of the plant parts were found to have antimicrobial activity on S. aureus. They also found that the water extract showed antimicrobial activity on S. aureus and E. coli.
